meanings.definition: A sudden gush or burst of something
meanings.sent1: The water hose had spurts of water coming out.
meanings.sent2: The soda can had spurts of fizz when opened.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn machine had a few spurts of kernels popping out unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The volcano erupted with spurts of lava shooting into the sky.
meanings.sent5: The burst pipe caused spurts of water to flood the basement.

meanings.definition: To gush or shoot out in a stream
meanings.sent1: The fountain spurts water high into the air.
meanings.sent2: The whale spurts water from its blowhole.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy spurts water from the hose while playing in the yard.
meanings.sent4: The pressure washer spurts out a powerful stream to clean the driveway.
meanings.sent5: The tea kettle spurts steam when it reaches boiling point.

meanings.definition: To make a sudden, energetic effort
meanings.sent1: She spurts ahead in the race with a burst of speed.
meanings.sent2: The car spurts forward when the driver presses the gas pedal.
meanings.sent3: The child spurts up the stairs to get to bed before bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The athlete spurts towards the finish line with determination.
meanings.sent5: The student spurts through the homework to finish before dinner.
